Thiamine ( Figure 1, No. 1) is one of the most important vitamins needed for proper cell metabolism. It performs several functions, of which the main is its role as a cofactor of important enzymes, such as pyruvate dehydrogenase complex (PDHC), transketolase, 2-oxoglutarate dehydrogenase complex and pyruvate decarboxylase
